section.title: Why do you show the number of messages and not the number of replies for a topic on the list page?
section.para:
In short: the people writing the code liked it better. If you want to show the number of replies, you can modify your template by putting this line of code in your lists.tpl template file:
<?php $PHORUM['TMP']['MESSAGES']['thread_count']--; ?>
Put that line right after the line that says:
{LOOP MESSAGES}

section.title: Does Phorum have avatars or user rankings like (insert UBB clone)?
Why do unregistered users not have new message indicators?
section.para: In Phorum 3, the data for the new message indicators was stored inside cookies. That way, both registered and unregistered users could see them. However, because of many cookie problems that plagued Phorum 3, we decided to store all user settings in the database for Phorum 5 instead. The down side of this is that users must be registered to show new messages. The up side is that the new indicators really work like they should in Phorum 5: messages that are read stay read when switching browser or computer.

section.title: What are sticky topics?
section.para: Sticky topics (a.k.a. "stickies") are topics that stay at the top of the forum they are posted in and do not get bumped down as new topics are posted. Often, sticky topics are used to post a forum FAQ or forum rules, so new users will always find these at the start of the forum topic list.

section.title: Can I post announcements?
section.para: For announcements, create a forum in which you will post announcement messages. Setup the permissions in such way that only the users who are allowed to create new announcements can post to this forum.
After this, go to the Modules page in the admin interface. There, you can enable the "Announcements" module and edit its settings to point it at the new announcement forum.

section.title: How do I stop spammers from signing up and posting on my forum?
section.para: From Phorum 5.2 onwards, the comprehensive Spam Hurdles module is included, which includes a number of spam prevention tools, including CAPTCHA (Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart). For more information on this and other modules, have a look at the Administrator Manual.
